result.title: Analysis of the online survey and citizen consultations
result.description: The report will summarise the input and findings from the EU-wide online survey with 10,000 respondents, and the discussions at the 9 national citizen consultations, on which pro-active energy citizenship scenarios will be co-created.

result.title: Analytical report on PESTEL factors in the national and local context
result.description: This deliverable will incorporate nine national analytical reports explaining the political economic social technological environmental and legal conditions in which energy citizenship has developed in nine partner countries This comprehensive report will juxtapose the national contexts against the common EU frame and outline the countryspecific conditions that appear to either support or hinder the development of active energy citizenship

result.title: Consolidated EnergyPROSPECTS Conceptual framework
result.description: This deliverable forms the concluding synthesis of WP2. Based on external feedback, conceptual advances and the empirical insights developed in WP3, WP4 and WP5, the deliverable provides empirically informed and conceptually refined insights into active energy citizenship, the associated broader range of citizenship, and the relevant empowerment processes and supportive conditions that shape it.

result.description: The report will present the detailed analysis of the EU context and explain the major political economic social technological environmental and legal conditions that shape the emergence manifestations and transformations of energy citizenship The report will serve as the reference point for the energy citizenship as observed in different national and local contexts

result.title: Final report on capacity building, training and education activities
result.description: This report will provide information on the activities performed in Task 3 of this work-package. It will present the developed set of innovative capacity building activities to implement access services and, more generally, to attract industrial and research community users. It will also describe the developed new training programme tailored to the needs of existing and potential new users (see WP1, WP2, WP4 and WP5), to support the access pilots (Task 3.2) and how the programme strongly supports the new services developed.It will describe and summarise the specific workshops on CCUS that have been organised in conjunction with existing popular summer schools and how those raised awareness of ECCSEL ERIC. It will also summarise the tailored training courses, workshops and seminars that have been organised to attract new users, Early Career Researchers (ECRs), and industrial and SME user groups to ECCSEL ERIC (delivered face-to-face and using online methods e.g. live training sessions (webinars), on-line dissemination material, to widely promote ECCSEL ERIC, to better train its users, and widen its reach).It will also detail how ECCSEL ERIC is invest in education, linking its capacity-building programme to educational programmes, and including doctoral candidates, technical staff and students in the research activities performed within ECCSEL facilities.

project.title: ECCSEL ERIC accelerating user access, growing the membership and positioning internationally to ensure long-term sustainability

programme.title: Developing new world-class research infrastructures

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: EXCELLENT SCIENCE - Research Infrastructures

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Individual support to ESFRI and other world-class research infrastructures

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Report on improved access framework
result.description: The ECCSEL ERIC access framework will be implemented and adapted to improve the services offered and its uptake by users (especially industry). In this report, starting from the needs of different user groups (e.g. academia, business, industry and public services), and taking into account the inputs provided by WP1 and WP2 on expected services and innovation, a new access framework will be developed. Particularly, this deliverable defines bespoke solutions and good practice in services among RIs that will be shared to promote international cooperation, to implement sharing of results, to improve the level of research and strengthen the attractiveness of ECCSEL ERIC within the ERA. Finally, the effects of the adopted solutions will be reviewed and progressively refined on the basis of the access pilots outcomes.

project.title: ECCSEL ERIC accelerating user access, growing the membership and positioning internationally to ensure long-term sustainability

result.title: Energy Citizenship Academy Report
result.description: A report on the activities and impacts of the Energy Citizenship Academy, which is intended to upscale energy citizenship through digital training programmes targeting key stakeholders within and beyond the EU. The report will include five elements: (i) branding and communication plan; (ii) 6 online training modules; (iii) monitoring and evaluation report; (iv) reports from advanced online training sessions; (v) exploitation plan.

result.title: Report on experimental lab studies on energy citizenship
result.description: Report on the results of six experimental lab studies conducted in (at least) three countries. The lab studies will investigate possible personal- and group/organizational-level predictors of energy citizenship (e.g. economic set-up of energy community) as well as the effects of energy citizenship on members and non-members of energy communities.

result.title: Conceptual typology
result.description: This deliverable elaborates the fundamentals of the conceptual framework (D2.1) into a conceptual typology. The deliverable elaborates, systematizes and operationalises the key conceptual distinctions into empirical observables and examples, analytical categories, and sensitising concepts for further empirical analyses (WP3-6) and for activities in dissemination (WPs 1 and 7). This second stage in conceptualization ensures that the conceptual framework provides sufficient foothold for the development of empirically grounded typologies, and for application throughout the project (analysis in thematic work packages, but also policy advice and dissemination activities).
